Posts.Content: So I've been on tamoxifen for 7 months now and we all know that sweating and hot flashes are a part of it, right? Now it's Dec and colder in NY and I am worse than when it was 95 in the summer! We've been Christmas shopping and I go out wearing lightweight pants and a short sleeve shirt, everyone else is in winter coats and boots. I'm in a store for a few minutes and the sweat is pouring off of me! Mind you I have my hair in a ponytail to keep it off my neck and it is, sorry to be gross, saturated! I can actually wring out my ponytail and fill a bucket!! The littlest activity leaves me dripping! I have to actually blow dry my hair a few times a day and wash it every night. Is this normal? Is anyone else experiencing this? Again, I could understand if it was summer and hot but it's not! It's driving me crazy!! I am just one big sweaty mess : ) Angela
Posts.Title: Excessive sweating caused by meds?

Posts.Content: I have been on it now 2 months. it took till week 5 to start the hot flashes. they were bad, every 30 minutes! then I was very tired all day. I was put on effexor and my hot flashes are better. they are more like normal menopause flashes. i solved the exhaustion by taking the tamox at night. now I sleep better. i do get bone aches. it seems to have inflamed my already bad knee. at times my hip joints hurt. I have gained weight. I won't even get on the scale anymore because it is too depressing. the weird side effect is that smells bother me. i have always been sensitive to smells but now it's like i'm pregnant! the smell of cooking eggs or meat makes me gag! I don't have much choice except to not take it and risk a recurrence,so I suffer through! Hopefully you will be lucky and not have any issues. angela
Posts.Title: 1st day of Tamoxifen....what to expect...5 yrs!!!

Posts.Content: Denise, what are they giving you for a prep? I had to take 2 dulcalax tabs at 3pm and then at 5pm mix miralax with gatoraid. The Miralax is totally tasteless and not that bad in the cramping and elimination stuff. I only finished half the drink because I was sick of the gatorade, but still cleaned out. So much better than what they used to use. angela
Posts.Title: O.T. Monday annual colonscopy

Posts.Content: Good luck Dawne!! Keep up the positive attitude, it helps a lot!! Angela
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: Hugs and prayers heading your way. Angela
Posts.Title: Monday's Biopsy Results

Posts.Content: To be able to talk to some-one who understands everything you are feeling and doesn't judge you when you cry. The help, advice, support and friendship that is given unconditionally and with so much love. Angela
Posts.Title: Sometimes we don't always say it but...............

Posts.Content: Denise I know this can't be easy for you. I know that feeling of "not again." You will get through it though. Think of the hospital stay as a small vacation from cleaning and cooking and caring for everyone else. Spend it relaxing and catching up on tv shows. While not the best place to be you can still make the most of it and be babied and cared for. It just sucks that you have to endure all this but you will get through it. I don't even know you well but get the feeling that you will be fine. I will be thinking of you~ Angela
Posts.Title: pre op testing

Posts.Content: I hear you. I'm hoping you will be able to go on that trip! Sending good thoughts our way!! Nothing like sitting by the fire at night listening to all the sounds! I love camping~
Posts.Title: pre op testing
Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: Denise, we are going in June too for daughter's college graduation! When are you going? Angela

Posts.Title: Update on mammo freak out!

Posts.Content: Hugs for all you great woman who helped me at the worst time in my life!! I wouldn't have made it w/o you!!!! HUGS~~ Angela
Posts.Title: GROUP HUG time!

Posts.Content: Melanie, I was going to tell you cellulitis. I have had 6 boughts of it since my surgery last March. Had a really bad infection right after surgery too. Keep an eye on it even after it clears up. It can become chronic, so if you ever feel this way again, make sure it hasn't come back. Also, make sure it is totally cleared up before you stop the antibiotics because it will come back after a few days. I hope you feel better soon and never have to deal with it again. Good luck to you! Angela
Posts.Title: infection at mastectomy site

Posts.Content: I felt the same way. I actually started to cry as I was handed my "diploma". I was sad to know that these girls that took care of me wouldn't be an active part in my life any more. I felt very sad and weepy for a few weeks after. I guess it is all normal. I felt like as long as I was getting treatment everything would be ok. Now that nothing is being done I started to worry about the what ifs. I am now 2 months out of rads and finally starting to feel better, less weepy. I have also started tamoxifen and now effexor.So know, you are normal : ) and not alone!!!! Angela
Posts.Title: Having a really hard time...

Posts.Content: I guess that says it all and I must endure. My aunt is on her second go round of this. First time 15 years ago and now a new accurance 2 years ago. I guess if she can plow through the bone pain and hot flashes I can too. angela
Posts.Title: For those on the fence about tamoxifen and ER+....please read

Posts.Content: Eva, mine were so bad I was put on Effexor. Now they are tolerable. I would walk around with a beat red face and dripping, it was so bad. W/i 2 weeks of Effexor I felt 90% better. angela
Posts.Title: How to minimize hot flashes from Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Rest and feel better. Don't rush the process. Hugs for an easy recovery! Angela
Posts.Title: I'm home surgery done
